understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method that returns the commit log sync configuration value.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is directly related to the configuration as it retrieves the commit log sync configuration value from the configuration object.

config_description: the default option is "periodic" where writes may be acked immediately and the CommitLog is simply synced every commitlog_sync_period_in_ms milliseconds.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'commitlog_sync' determines the type of CommitLog service to use in the code. Depending on the value of 'commitlog_sync' set in the DatabaseDescriptor, the code will instantiate either a PeriodicCommitLogService, BatchCommitLogService, or GroupCommitLogService to handle CommitLog operations.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'commitlog_sync' configuration depends on the type of CommitLog service selected. For example, if 'commitlog_sync' is set to 'periodic', the CommitLog will be synced every commitlog_sync_period_in_ms milliseconds.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'commitlog_sync' configuration option on the system is significant as it determines how frequently the CommitLog is synced. Choosing a more frequent syncing option may provide better durability guarantees but can also impact performance due to increased disk I/O operations.
